aquametNWCA 2.4.4

    Calculate Wetland Indicator Status metrics

    calcWIS.Rd

    This function calculates Wetland Indicator Status (WIS) metrics, including variations based on native status, if NWCA_NATSTAT is present in the input data frame.

    calcWIS(vascIn, sampID = "UID")

    Arguments

    vascIn

    Data frame containing cover data summarized by UID and TAXON, with the following fields:

    • sampID: Variable(s) identified in sampID argument

    • TAXON: Taxon name

    • WIS: Wetland Indicator Status, with possible values of FAC, FACU, FACW, OBL, UPL, NL, TBD, or missing. NL is recoded to UPL in function, TBD is recoded to missing in function.

    • FREQ: Frequency of taxon among plots at site

    • XABCOV: Mean percent cover of taxon across plots

    • TOTN: Number of taxa in sample

    • sXRCOV: proportion of summed cover across all taxa (XTOTABCOV) represented by taxon in sample

    • NWCA_NATSTAT (optional): Native status variable with categories of 'NAT', 'ADV', 'CRYP', 'INTR', 'UND'. UND taxa are ignored.

    sampID

    A character vector containing the name(s) of variable(s) necessary to identify unique samples, 'UID' by default

    Value

    Data frame containing sampID variables, PARAMETER, RESULT, where values of PARAMETER consist of the metric name concatenated with trait value (represented as TRAITNM below):

    • N_TRAITNM: Number of taxa with trait

    • PCTN_TRAITNM: Number of taxa with trait as percentage of TOTN

    • XABCOV_TRAITNM: Sum of XABCOV values across taxa with trait

    • XRCOV_TRAITNM: Sum of sXRCOV values across taxa with trait

    In addition WIS indices based on all and native species only (if NWCA_NATSTAT is provided in the input data frame), with the suffixes ALL and NAT, respectively. WIS values recoded as numeric with OBL=1, FACW=2, FAC=3, FACU=4, UPL=5 for WETIND metrics and as OBL=5, FACW=4, FAC=3 FACU=2, and UPD=1 for WETIND2 metrics:

    • WETIND_COV_ALL, WETIND_COV_NAT: Wetland Index, weighted by taxon cover, based on numeric conversion of WIS, with lower numbers indicating wetter conditions

    • WETIND_FREQ_ALL, WETIND_FREQ_NAT: Wetland Index, weight by frequency, based on numeric conversion of WIS, with lower numbers indicating wetter conditions

    • WETIND2_COV_ALL, WETIND2_COV_NAT: Wetland Index, weighted by taxon cover, based on numeric conversion of WIS, with higher numbers indicating wetter conditions

    • WETIND2_FREQ_ALL, WETIND2_FREQ_NAT: Wetland Index, weight by frequency, based on numeric conversion of WIS, with higher numbers indicating wetter conditions

    If NWCA_NATSTAT is provided in the input data frame, the following metrics are calculated based on Alien + Cryptogenic species:

    • N_OBLFACW_AC: Number of alien and cryptogenic taxa with WIS of either OBL or FACW.

    • XABCOV_OBLFACW_AC: Mean absolute cover of alien and cryptogenic taxa with WIS of either OBL or FACW.

    • XRCOV_OBLFACW_AC: Mean relative cover of alien and cryptogenic taxa with WIS of either OBL or FACW.

    References

    US Environmental Protection Agency. 2016. National Wetland Condition Assessment: 2011 Technical Report. EPA-843-R-15-006. US Environmental Protection Agency, Washington, DC.

    Author

    Karen Blocksom Blocksom.karen@epa.gov

    Examples

    head(VascPlantEx)
#>   UID STATE USAC_REGION PLOT             USDA_NAME COVER
#> 1   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    2 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA    28
#> 2   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    3 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA     6
#> 3   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    4 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA     5
#> 4   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    5 SAGITTARIA LANCIFOLIA    20
#> 5   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    5       SPARTINA PATENS     0
#> 6   7    FL  CSTL_PLAIN    1      PANICUM VIRGATUM     0
exPlant <- prepareData(VascPlantEx,
  taxon_name = "USDA_NAME",
  inTaxa = taxaNWCA, inNat = ccNatNWCA, inCVal = ccNatNWCA,
  inWIS = wisNWCA, cValReg = "STATE"
)
#> [1] "Will not be able to calculate metrics using DUR_ALT,GRH_ALT,HERB,TREE_COMB,SHRUB_COMB,VINE_ALL without these parameters in inTaxa"
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "byUID"  "byPlot"
#>  [1] "TAXON"           "STATE"           "UID"             "USAC_REGION"    
#>  [5] "NUM"             "XABCOV"          "NPLOTS"          "DISTINCT"       
#>  [9] "SPECIES_NAME_ID" "FAMILY"          "GENUS"           "CATEGORY"       
#> [13] "GROWTH_HABIT"    "DURATION"        "NWCA_CC"        
#>  [1] "TAXON"           "USAC_REGION"     "STATE"           "UID"            
#>  [5] "NUM"             "XABCOV"          "NPLOTS"          "DISTINCT"       
#>  [9] "SPECIES_NAME_ID" "FAMILY"          "GENUS"           "CATEGORY"       
#> [13] "GROWTH_HABIT"    "DURATION"        "NWCA_CC"         "NWCA_NATSTAT"   
#> [17] "WIS"            
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done with plot summing"
#> [1] "Done with sampID summing"
#> [1] "Done preparing datasets"

wisEx <- calcWIS(exPlant$byUIDspp)

head(wisEx)
#>          UID PARAMETER RESULT
#> 5.N_FAC    5     N_FAC      0
#> 8.N_FAC    8     N_FAC      0
#> 10.N_FAC  10     N_FAC      0
#> 7.N_FAC    7     N_FAC      1
#> 9.N_FAC    9     N_FAC      3
#> 3.N_FAC    3     N_FAC      4
unique(wisEx$PARAMETER)
#>  [1] "N_FAC"               "N_FACU"              "N_FACW"             
#>  [4] "N_OBL"               "N_UPL"               "PCTN_FAC"           
#>  [7] "PCTN_FACU"           "PCTN_FACW"           "PCTN_OBL"           
#> [10] "PCTN_UPL"            "XABCOV_FAC"          "XABCOV_FACU"        
#> [13] "XABCOV_FACW"         "XABCOV_OBL"          "XABCOV_UPL"         
#> [16] "XRCOV_FAC"           "XRCOV_FACU"          "XRCOV_FACW"         
#> [19] "XRCOV_OBL"           "XRCOV_UPL"           "N_OBL_FACW"         
#> [22] "PCTN_OBL_FACW"       "XABCOV_OBL_FACW"     "XRCOV_OBL_FACW"     
#> [25] "N_OBL_FACW_FAC"      "PCTN_OBL_FACW_FAC"   "XABCOV_OBL_FACW_FAC"
#> [28] "XRCOV_OBL_FACW_FAC"  "N_FAC_FACU"          "PCTN_FAC_FACU"      
#> [31] "XABCOV_FAC_FACU"     "XRCOV_FAC_FACU"      "WETIND_COV_ALL"     
#> [34] "WETIND_FREQ_ALL"     "WETIND2_COV_ALL"     "WETIND2_FREQ_ALL"   
#> [37] "WETIND_COV_NAT"      "WETIND_FREQ_NAT"     "WETIND2_COV_NAT"    
#> [40] "WETIND2_FREQ_NAT"    "N_OBLFACW_AC"        "XRCOV_OBLFACW_AC"   
#> [43] "XABCOV_OBLFACW_AC"
